<div class="section-card">
  <h2>Background</h2>
  <p>I am passionate about using data science to solve environmental challenges while maintaining a deep commitment to the human stories behind the numbers. I believe that the most powerful research emerges from the intersection of technical rigor, creative thinking, and genuine care for the communities we serve.</p>
  
  <p>Currently pursuing a PhD in Environmental Data Science at UCSB, my research focuses on developing machine learning models to analyze satellite imagery and track environmental changes across Sub-Saharan Africa. I am particularly interested in applying these tools to biodiversity conservation, wildlife corridor mapping, and indigenous land rights monitoring.</p>
  
  <p>Beyond the laboratory, I maintain an active creative practice and community involvement, organizing environmental initiatives and exploring how data-driven insights can translate into meaningful environmental action.</p>
